parameters.name: connectInstanceARN
parameters.description: Amazon Connect instance ARN that solution will use. For example: arn:aws:connect:{region}:111111111111:instance/aaaaaaaa-bbbb-cccc-dddd-eeeeeeeeeeee

parameters.name: connectInstanceURL
parameters.description: Amazon Connect instance URL that solution will use. For example: https://connect-instance-alias.awsapps.com

parameters.name: connectDefaultContactFlowId
parameters.description: This is Amazon Connect Contact Flow Id for the Contact Flow to be started when a new Chat contact is initiated. For example: aaaaaaaa-bbbb-cccc-dddd-eeeeeeeeeeee

parameters.name: cognitoDomainPrefix
parameters.description: Please provide a prefix for Amazon Cognito hosted UI domain, where users will be redirected during the login process. The domain prefix has to be unique, and you could put your Amazon Connect Instance Alias to it. For example: video-call-escalation-connect-instance-alias

parameters.name: agentAPIAllowedOrigins
parameters.description: Please provide the domain of your agent application, to allow CORS. For example: https://aaaabbbbcccc.cloudfront.net

parameters.name: websiteAPIAllowedOrigins
parameters.description: Please provide the domain of your website, to allow CORS. For example: https://aaaabbbbcccc.cloudfront.net

parameters.name: websiteAdHocRouteBaseURL
parameters.description: Please provide the full URL of your website, for example: https://aaaabbbbcccc.cloudfront.net/demo-website.html . To create a link for ad-hoc route which agents can share with customers, websiteAdHocRouteBaseURL is concatenated with a generated Route Id. For demo purposes, agent-app and demo-website have the same host (CloudFront), hence you can leave this parameter empty.

parameters.name: cognitoSAMLEnabled
parameters.description: If SSO/SAML is enabled, set to true, otherwise set to false

parameters.name: ccpLoginLambdaRoleToAssume
parameters.description: AWS IAM Role that will be assumed by ccpLogin Lambda when connect.GetFederationToken is invoked. This is typically needed when SSO federation is enabled, otherwise this parameter can be left empty. Please note that CDK expects this Role to already be created. For example: arn:aws:iam::111111111111:role/AmazonConnectSSO

parameters.name: cognitoSAMLIdentityProviderURL
parameters.description: If SSO/SAML was enabled, please provide IdP Metadata URL. For example: https://portal.sso.{region}.amazonaws.com/saml/metadata/aaabbbcccdddeee

parameters.name: cognitoSAMLIdentityProviderName
parameters.description: If SSO/SAML was enabled, please provide the Identity Provide name. For example: AWSSSO

parameters.name: cognitoSAMLCallbackUrls
parameters.description: If SSO/SAML was enabled, please provide a callback URL for the Amazon Cognito authorization server to call after users are authenticated. This should be set to your application root URL. For example: https://aaaabbbbcccc.cloudfront.net

parameters.name: cognitoSAMLLogoutUrls
parameters.description: If SSO/SAML was enabled, please provide a logout URL where user is to be redirected after logging out.

parameters.name: cdkPipelineEnabled
parameters.description: If you want to use CDK Pipelines to deploy the solution, set to true. Otherwise, set to false

parameters.name: cdkPipelineRepositoryName
parameters.description: The name of the CodeCommit Repository

parameters.name: cdkPipelineRepositoryBranchName
parameters.description: The name of the CodeCommit Repository Branch

parameters.name: cdkPipelineCreateNewRepository
parameters.description: To create a new CodeCommit Repository, set to true. Otherwise, set to false

parameters.name: cdkPipelineStageName
parameters.description: The name of Stage in the CDK pipeline

parameters.name: deployRecordingStack
parameters.description: If you want to enable video call recording, set to true. Otherwise, set to false

parameters.name: recordingPlaybackSecurityProfileId
parameters.description: Amazon Connect Security Profile that allows users to playback video recordings

parameters.name: recordingAttendeeName
parameters.description: Displayed as attendee name when recording is started

parameters.name: recordingPresignedURLExpiresMinutes
parameters.description: Amazon S3 Presigned URL expire time, in minutes, for call recording files
